emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that can adapt and execute based on real-time data analysis using AI.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces need for intermediaries, increases contract efficiency, but raises concerns about AI bias and security.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legal frameworks, AI ethics, security protocols

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transport Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A network of self-governing autonomous vehicles managed via blockchain for route optimization and fare distribution.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes mobility as a service, reduces traffic congestion, but requires significant infrastructure changes.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory approval, infrastructure investment, public trust in autonomous systems

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Interface for Memory Markets
emerging_technologies.description: A system where individuals can lease or sell their cognitive capabilities or memories, secured by blockchain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Raises ethical issues about ownership of memories and cognitive capacity, potential for misuse.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical guidelines, privacy laws, technological maturity

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Tokenization
emerging_technologies.description: Tokenization of space resources for trading and ownership verification on Earth.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could democratize space exploration, but also risks creating new forms of space colonization.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: International space law, economic viability, technological advancements in space mining

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Knowledge Proofs for Data Privacy
emerging_technologies.description: Applications where users can prove possession of information without revealing it, enhancing privacy.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances personal data protection, reduces data breaches, but might complicate legal investigations.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Computational efficiency, regulatory acceptance, user trust in privacy mechanisms

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy trading through tokens representing green energy production or consumption.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in regions with supportive policy frameworks, integrating with smart grids.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Drones
mainstream_technologies.description: Drones for delivery, surveillance, and environmental monitoring, autonomously managed by AI.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Commonplace in logistics and agriculture, with ongoing debates about privacy and airspace regulations.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems where governance is distributed through blockchain technology.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Empowers individuals with more control over their data and decisions, potentially reducing corruption but increasing complexity in governance.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased interest in democratic tech solutions, rise in DAOs for various sectors, push for regulatory frameworks.

epoch_themes.theme: Integration of AI in Daily Life
epoch_themes.description: AI becoming an integral part of everyday activities and decisions.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances efficiency and personalization but necessitates ethical frameworks to address AI bias and privacy issues.
epoch_themes.global_trends: AI ethics becoming a major field, AI education, and widespread AI integration in services.
